title: 【五毛當】"Why do so many HK expats hate the protestors?"

replies.msg:
Recently my friend was tricked by 五毛當😅

We know that China's "50-cent army" (a.k.a. mindless losers) use social media accounts to try to influence opinion around the world.

SCMP newspaper in Hong Kong is a great example! Recently my friend in Taiwan asked me "Why do so many HK expats hate the protestors?"

I said "Huh?!"

Finally, I can understand why he asked it. He had tried to read the comments section of the newspaper. And was tricked 🤦

"But their English is so good!"

No it's not!.... it's fake "good English" that has strong mainland characteristics. Warning signs:

--overuse of English colloquialisms, i.e. trying to appear idiomatic. A normal person just writes directly

--essay-style logic: "A then B, therefore C". Anyone could do this, but the Chinese bots do it again and again! And with really twisted logic

--"we Hong Kongers" "we expats" "we Americans"... a normal person commenting probably wouldn't try to represent others like this

--similarly: loudly claiming to be American/German/Malaysian etc. i.e. not Chinese. Normal people would not bring this up unless it is totally relevant

--defending China's honour. This one is obvious 🤣... what person on the face of Earth would defend the mainland... except mainlanders 😅

Can you think of some other warning signs?

Long post, thanks for reading. 香港加油！
